txt.en:
'It is no wonder, [placeholder], that you are welcomed throughout the lands... your display of arms today was unparalleled!

'Today, we have proven that we determine our own fates... go to the Aldor, if you will, and relate to him the tale of our glorious battle and the odds we overcame. Perhaps then he will see reason and send the women and children to Edoras or Dunharrow.

'My companions and I cannot wait for your return. We must be off at once for Cliving and the Mead Hall of Athelward. Farewell, my friend.'

You relate the tale of your battle against the Easterlings to Harding, and he nods, impressed.

'You have acquitted yourself well, but that was your fate. Mine is to die at the hands of the Easterlings while defending the people of the Eastemnet. This cannot be changed.

'I am afraid that your efforts, as I told you before, were in vain.'
You rode forth with the Riders Four and defeated a large patrol of Khundolar Easterlings in the hope of convincing Aldor Harding that his assumed fate can be avoided.
Talk to Harding in the Mead Hall of Harwick
Aldor Harding is in the Mead Hall of Harwick.\n\nBurnoth has asked you to go to Aldor Harding and convince him of the folly of omens and the wisdom of sending the women and children away to safety.
